name: Carl L. Bausch Jr.
bio: Carl L. Bausch, Jr. studied architecture at Princeton University and graduated with honors in 1939. After serving in the Army during World War II, he moved to Vermont in 1946 to take a teaching position at the Newton School in the town of Jamaica. It was at this time that he also began designing and building his first house, which remains standing today. While most of Bauschâ€™s projects were in southern Vermont, he designed two houses for himself in northern Vermont - one in Shelburne and one in East Charlotte.
